data.title: It took Ashton Kutcher and Mila Kunis 14 years to start dating. Here's a timeline of their relationship.
data.meta_description: The costar celebrities met on "That '70s Show," but it took years for their real-life romance to begin. Now they've been married for over eight years.
data.text:
This story is available exclusively to Business Insider subscribers. Become an Insider and start reading now. Have an account? .

Ashton Kutcher and Mila Kunis met on "That '70s Show" but didn't start dating until years later.

Both actors were in serious relationships with other people before they rekindled in 2012.

Kutcher and Kunis got married in 2015 and they have two kids together.

Advertisement

1998: Mila Kunis and Ashton Kutcher met as castmates on "That '70s Show."

The celebrities first met playing Jackie Burkhart (Kunis) and Michael Kelso (Kutcher) on Fox's "That '70s Show" — they were 14 and 20, respectively, when the pilot episode aired in 1998.

The casting director required the lead actors to be 18 years old, but per CheatSheet, Kunis told Jay Leno in 2012 that she lied about her age to get the part.

"I told them I was gonna be 18, which, you know — I've said this story before — it's not technically a lie, cause at one point— given all things went right — I was gonna be 18," she said. "They figured out sooner or later that I wasn't, but that's OK."

That lie led her to be cast as Jackie, Kelso's girlfriend.

Advertisement

1998: They had their first (on-screen) kiss.

Kunis' very first kiss was a scripted one between Jackie and Kelso on "That '70s Show."

In 2001, she told People that they were practically strangers at the time, and that she had a crush on him.

"I was like, 'Oh, he's so cute, it's the Calvin Klein model," she said. "Then I was like, 'I have to kiss him?' I was so nervous and uncomfortable. I had the biggest crush on him."

At the time, Kutcher didn't know it was Kunis' first kiss, and their age difference apparently made things a little awkward.

"I'm the first guy she kissed? Oh my god, I had no idea," he told People in 2001. "I'm so glad I didn't know that or it would've been too much pressure."

Kurtwood Smith, who played Red Forman on the show told E! in 2012, "Of course they played boyfriend and girlfriend, but they had completely separate lives … Mila was a kid. That was awkward for Ashton at the beginning. He was like 19 and she was like 14 or 15."

Advertisement

November 16, 2005: Kutcher left "That '70s Show."

After seven seasons, Kutcher and costar Topher Grace didn't renew their contracts with"That 70's Show." Kutcher stuck around for the first four episodes of season eight and didn't return until the series finale in 2006.

Though this effectively ended his in-person contact with Kunis, per Elle, the actress told Howard Stern in 2016 that she kept in touch with Kutcher after he left.

"When we first ran into each other, we'd always kept in touch on like AIM … " she said. "So we always kept in touch since after ''70s.'"

But she added that, at that point, she wasn't thinking about him romantically.

September 24, 2005: Kutcher married Demi Moore.

In the fall of 2005, Kutcher married actress Demi Moore and became a step-father to her three daughters from her marriage to Bruce Willis.

Advertisement

January 2011: Kunis and then-boyfriend Macaulay Culkin split up.

Kunis and Macaulay Culkin started dating in 2002, but by 2011, they called it quits.

Advertisement

November 17, 2011: Moore announced that she and Kutcher were getting a divorce.

At the end of 2011, Moore announced her plans to divorce Kutcher.

"It is with great sadness and a heavy heart that I have decided to end my six-year marriage to Ashton," she said in a statement that was published by CNN.

According to Reuters, Kutcher also tweeted that day, "Marriage is one of the most difficult things in the world and unfortunately sometimes they fail."

Advertisement

January 15, 2012: Kutcher and Kunis reconnected at the 69th Golden Globe Awards.

After ending things with their other partners, Kutcher and Kunis hit it off at the award show.

"I was looking around, and there was a really beautiful man from the back," Kunis told Marc Maron on his podcast in 2018. "I was literally like, 'Oh, he's kinda hot.' … And then he turned around, and I was like, 'Oh, my God, it's Kutch.'"

She continued, "I thought it was the weirdest thing that I was checking this guy out, and it was someone that I had known forever."

They started talking, and Kutcher invited her to his Hollywood Hills housewarming party.

Advertisement

January 2012: They had their first (off-screen) kiss at Kutcher's housewarming party.

Per Elle, Kunis and Kutcher had slightly different recollections of the party, which they told on separate appearances on "The Howard Stern Show."

"I think I was smoking cigarettes at the time, and I was still a smoker," Kutcher said. "And she had quit smoking and she was like, she wanted me to like shotgun a cigarette smoke so she could breathe it in and I was like, 'All right.'"

He continued, "And I started doing this. And gradually through the night, it got closer and closer and closer … It was kind of obvious that things were happening."

Kunis had previously told Stern her version of the party.

"I brought a girlfriend with me. I was like, 'You have to come with me, because just in case,'" she said. "So lo and behold he was trying to set me up with a friend of his."

Advertisement

January 2012: They started hooking up regularly.

On the same 2018 episode of Maron's "WTF" podcast, Kunis told the host that she and Kutcher started hooking up at the beginning of 2012.

"It was the first time ever that I ever slept over at a guy's house since becoming single ..." she said. "When I was single, I was so adamant about never staying at a guy's house, that I was like peacing out. And he was like, 'You're not leaving.' And that was the first time [I didn't.]"

She added that, ironically, the previous year they'd both been in movies with similar plot lines about two people trying to make a "friends with benefits" relationship work.

"I did a movie called 'Friends With Benefits.' He did a movie that was very similar called 'No Strings Attached.' We lived our movies out," she said. "We were just like, let's just hook up. Let's have fun. We're both single. We both trust each other. Everything's great."

Advertisement

April 2012: Kunis and Kutcher moved in together.

Just like their on-screen characters, the casual sex didn't last long.

"Three months later, I was like, 'This isn't fun anymore.'" Kunis said during her 2016 appearance on "The Howard Stern Show," per Elle.

"I was like, you know what, I actually care about you. I don't want to mess anything up so I'm just going to walk away before it becomes too much," she continued. "And he was like, 'Got it.'"

She said the next day, Kutcher asked her to move in with him.

"If we just paid attention to these movies [we did], we should know s--- like this does not work out in real life," Kunis said on the 2018 "WTF" episode.

Advertisement

November 26, 2013: Kutcher and Moore's divorce was finalized.

According to TMZ, a year after the couple first announced their split, Kutcher filed for divorce in LA. And by November 2013, the divorce was finalized.

February 2014: Kutcher and Kunis and Mila got engaged.

According to People, Kunis was first spotted sporting her Tiffany engagement ring on February 27, 2014.

Advertisement

May 9, 2014: Kunis revealed she was pregnant on "The Ellen DeGeneres Show."

A few months after news of the couple's engagement broke, Kunis told Ellen DeGeneres in 2014 that she was expecting their first child.

The actress told the host that she'd been craving sauerkraut and pickles throughout her pregnancy.

Advertisement

October 1, 2014: The couple welcomed their daughter, Wyatt Isabelle Kutcher.

Wyatt Isabelle Kutcher was born at Cedars-Sinai in Los Angeles.

"It's unbelievable. It's the greatest thing on Earth," Kutcher told Conan O'Brien later that month, per Us Weekly. "We're really privileged that we have time and can afford to take time. So we don't have a nanny or a night nurse of any of the stuff. It's just the two of us."

Advertisement

July 4, 2015: Kutcher and Kunis got married.

After being costars, friends, friends with benefits, and parents, Kutcher and Kunis officially became husband and wife.

"Commitment sounded great, but I didn't believe in marriage," Kunis told Glamour in 2016. "I grew up in West Hollywood, and my brother has reminded me that when I was like 12, I said, 'When gay people can get married, then I'll get married.' I was ahead of my time. The Supreme Court decision [on same-sex marriage came down], and that's when Ashton and I got married."

They got married in a very private ceremony in Oak Glen, California, on the Fourth of July.

November 30, 2016: Kunis gave birth to baby number two.

Though Kutcher was pushing for a little baby Hawkeye in honor of the University of Iowa — because the actor grew up in the state — the couple welcomed their son, Dimitri Portwood Kutcher, at the end of 2016.

Advertisement

December 3, 2017: They walked the red carpet for the first time as a couple.

After being a couple for five years, Kutcher and Kunis walked the red carpet together for the first time since their "That '70s Show" days at the Breakthrough Prize Awards.

Advertisement

March 4, 2020: Kutcher and Kunis did a joint podcast interview and talked about parenting.

In their first joint interview since doing press for "That '70s Show," the couple spoke with Brit Morin about acting and parenting on the first episode of her "Teach Me Something New" podcast.

"I think we're silly at home," Kunis said. "We're very goofy parents when it comes to our children. But ... none of that's skill, I think that's just being idiots. Like, I think we're very comfortable with ourselves acting a fool at home."

Advertisement

February 7, 2021: The couple appeared in a Super Bowl commercial together.

The celebrity couple doesn't often share the screen together anymore, but they partnered with Shaggy to film a Cheetos commercial for the 2021 Super Bowl.

"It's so silly!" Kunis told ET about the commercial. "Ashton and I, we never work together. I mean, I know we've worked together before [on 'That '70s Show' and more] … but in the midst of quarantine, they sent us this ad to do."

Advertisement

March 2022: The couple helped raise over $30 million for Ukrainian refugees.

After Russia invaded Ukraine at the end of February, Kutcher and Kunis (who emigrated from Ukraine when she was 7) started a GoFundMe to support refugees fleeing the country.

The pair have raised over $36 million for the cause.

"Once I realized that this thing is not going to end anytime tomorrow, I could wrap my head around the refugee situation, and not just the refugee problem, but the getting supplies into the country. And I knew that my husband and I could facilitate that," Kunis told CNN.

Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy even thanked Kunis and Kutcher for their efforts via a tweet.

Advertisement

July 25, 2022: Kutcher explained why he and Kunis decided to return for "The '90s Show."

At the red-carpet premiere of "Vengence," Kutcher spoke with Variety about his return to his roots playing Kelso on Netflix's upcoming "That '70s Show" reboot, "That '90s Show."

"Mila and I were contemplating it," he said. "We thought, 'Listen, we're only in the position that we're in because of that show, so let's just go back and do this.' We just went back and had fun for a week. It was so random and fun."

Kunis later told Access Hollywood how "weird" it was being back on the set with her now-husband.

"I was more nervous doing that than anything else in my career — to shoot with my husband on the set of 'That '70s show' because the set is exactly the same," she said, adding, "To be married but to be at the place where we met — and it looks the same — was trippy."

Advertisement

August 8, 2022: Kutcher opened up about a health scare a few years back.

While appearing on an episode of "Running Wild With Bear Grylls: The Challenge," Kutcher told the survivalist about a rare autoimmune disease he dealt with "like two years ago" just before the start of the COVID-19 pandemic.

"I had this weird, super rare form of vasculitis, that like knocked out my vision, it knocked out my hearing, it knocked out like all my equilibrium," the actor said.

He explained that it took him about a year to build those losses back.

Kunis later told Entertainment Tonight that the couple had to "power through" the illness together.

"I don't think you have time to sit down and talk, you kinda just power through," she said. "You go and deal with whatever health issue comes your way, but you still got kids, you still got a family, you have to live life. And I think that we are so fortunate to have one another, but as far as sitting there and incessantly talking about things, no. You gotta do."

Advertisement

September 28, 2022: Kutcher recounted the story of the first time he told Kunis he loved her.

In a TikTok video for Peloton, Kutcher told country singer Kenny Chesney about the first time he told Kunis he loves her — which happened to be while he was listing to Chesney's song "You and Tequila."

"I might have had a little too much tequila," Kutcher said. "I showed up drunk at her house at like two in the morning and started screaming, 'You and tequila make me crazy.' And I told her I love her, and she said, 'Don't say it if you don't mean it. Are you gonna love me in the morning when you wake up from this hangover?'"

Advertisement

January 19, 2023: The couple hit the screen again as Kelso and Jackie.

Kutcher and Kunis returned as Kelso and Jackie for a brief cameo on the first episode of Netflix's "That '90s Show," nearly 17 years after they last played the roles on "That '70s Show."

Although the couple only appeared the one time on the sequel series, their on-screen son, Jay, is one of the lead teens.

Advertisement

February 3, 2023: Kunis called her husband out for being awkward on the red carpet with Reese Witherspoon.

Kutcher and Witherspoon starred in Netflix's "Your Place or Mine," but after seeing pictures of the pair on the red carpet for the premiere, fans weren't feeling the chemistry.

On an episode of "Today," Witherspoon even said Kunis emailed her and Kutcher to say "You guys look so awkward on the red carpet together."

Per Us Weekly, in a promo clip for an episode of the "Chicks in the Office" podcast, Kutcher said, "My wife called me. She texted me and Reese together. She's like, 'Guys, you gotta, like, act like you each other.'"

But he defended their photos saying, "If I put my arm around her and was, like, all friendly with her, I'd be having an affair with her — the rumor would be that I'm having an affair with her."

Read next

Celebrity Couples Love

Advertisement
